raplog 0.1.0

Archive functions for logs at Rapporteket

Source: R/archive.R
archive.Rd

Functions to manage archiving of logs at Rapporteket. To be applied mainly as helpers within the raplog package.

createArchive(archivePath)

logsOverSize(logPath, overSize = 1024 * 1000, pattern = ".csv$")

archiveLog(archivePath, logPath, logs = c("appLog.csv", "reportLog.csv"))

cleanArchive(archivePath, eolDays = -1, pattern = ".rda$")

Arguments

archivePath

String providing the path to the archive directory
logPath

String providing the path to the log directory
overSize

Integer size in bytes from where larger files will be listed as candidates for archiving. Default value set to 1 Mb (1024 * 1000)
pattern

String regexp defining file name pattern
logs

String vector defining the log file names. Defaults to c("appLog.csv", "reportLog.csv")
eolDays

Integer age in days definig archive file end-of-life. When eoldays < 0 no archive files will be deleted. Default value is -1

Details

crateArchive simply creates a directory for the archived files to live in.

logsOverSize provides a character vector of relevant files for archiving based on the given size limit and file name pattern.

archiveLog do the actual archiving and deletes the source log files after the archive files where sucessfully created. Returns prematurely NULL if no log file(s) provided

cleanArchive deletes files from the archive as their days are numbered.

Examples

# Create an archive
createArchive(archivePath = tempfile())

# List all files (with alphanumeric names) larger than 1 Kb in tempdir()
logsOverSize(logPath = tempdir(), overSize = 1024,
pattern = "^[1-9a-zA-Z]")
#> [1] "file3ac249fdc07.so"              "libloc_173_c7ca16f4b15c0cc.rds" 
#> [3] "libloc_183_27f76f287b614bfa.rds"

# Archive a file under the same directory
fileName <- paste0(tempfile(), ".csv")
file.create(fileName)
#> [1] TRUE
write.csv(mtcars, fileName)
archiveLog(archivePath = dirname(fileName), logPath = dirname(fileName),
logs = c(basename(fileName)))
#> [1] TRUE

# Do not delete any files
cleanArchive(archivePath = tempdir())
#> NULL
